song.artist_names: Taylor Swift, Joy Williams & John Paul White

description.plain:
Taylor Swift announced on March 16th that as a surprise, she would release 4 songs at midnight to celebrate the first night of The Eras Tour. One of those songs being Safe & Sound (Taylor’s Version).

Safe & Sound was a duet she did The Civil Wars in 2012 for the soundtrack of the first ”The Hunger Games” Movie. Safe & Sound is a lullaby, sung by the protagonist, Katniss Everdeen to her younger sister Prim. The lyrics are about keeping Prim safe, and protecting her.

body.plain:
Taylor Swift announced on March 16th that as a surprise, she would release 4 songs at midnight to celebrate the first night of The Eras Tour. One of those songs being Safe & Sound (Taylor’s Version).

Safe & Sound was a duet she did The Civil Wars in 2012 for the soundtrack of the first ”The Hunger Games” Movie. Safe & Sound is a lullaby, sung by the protagonist, Katniss Everdeen to her younger sister Prim. The lyrics are about keeping Prim safe, and protecting her.

search_results.title: Front Porch
search_results.lyrics:
Front Porch Lyrics[Verse 1]
There are no wrong roads
And no window stays closed
And love is always sad when it fades
But glass is better stained anyways

[Chorus]
If never you find what you’re looking for
Come on back to the front porch
Say my name through the screen door
Come on back to the front porch
Whatever you’ve done, it doesn’t matter
'Cause darling we're all a little splintered and battered
But the light is on, what you waiting for?
Come on back, come on back to the front porch
[Verse 2]
We carved a story in these boards
Watching life go back and forth
You take it all for granted, then you leave
And then it takes a while to realize what you need

[Chorus]
If never you find what you’re looking for
Come on back to the front porch
Say my name through the screen door
Come on back to the front porch
Whatever you’ve done, it doesn’t matter
'Cause darling we're all a little splintered and battered
But the light is on, what you waiting for?
Come on back, come on back

[Bridge]
I took the long way
Looking for the shortcut
To find out that this place
Was made of the best of

[Chorus]
If never you find what you’re looking for
Come on back to the front porch
Say my name through the screen door
Oh, come on back to the front porch
Whatever you’ve done, it doesn’t matter
'Cause darling we're all a little splintered and battered
But the light is on, what you waiting for?
Come on back, come on back
Oh, come on back, come on back to the front porchYou might also like1Embed

song.embed_content: Read “Front Porch” by Joy Williams on Genius
song.title: Front Porch

annotations:
If never you find what you’re looking for
 Come on back to the front porch
 Say my name through the screen door
 Come on back to the front porch
 Whatever you’ve done, it doesn’t matter
 ’Cause darling we’re all a little splintered and battered
 But the light is on, what you waiting for?
 Come on back, come on back to the front porch

A front porch is emblematic of coming home.  It’s the first part of the house you enter, and to “come home” in the emotional/social sense means you must wait on the porch to be let inside.

The porch is a metaphor for the speaker’s life and heart.  The subject will always be welcome home (the speaker’s heart).

“Splintered and battered” extends the metaphor, as the wood porch and the front door may be splintered and worn from use, but they are still serviceable.  The speaker is saying that no matter what, even though they have been hurt, they are welcome home.

“The light is on” further carries this metaphor, as a light calls someone home and indicates that someone is at home to welcome them.

And love is always sad when it fades
 But glass is better stained anyways

The two lines are both tied to the duo before it. Love is not permanent and will eventually fade just like no window stays closed forever. When it does, it always leaves us devastated.

However, like there are no “wrong roads” in our life, we gained experiences and our hearts grew firmer through each heart-breaks. In spite of the devastation and the sadness, they carry us forward and one should not regret falling in and out of love.

Lastly, glass refers to our heart. And “stained” carries two meanings: Literally, it is the coloured glass commonly seen in churches that obviously look far better than common glass. Figuratively, it means a literal stain, a smear, a rift, a scar in our heart. Williams is saying that the more scarred the heart, the more beautiful it is from all the pains it had gone through and all of its courageous attempts at rejuvenation. Its willingness to partake in the cruel cycle of loving and breaking apart until it finds the right one for it.

There are no wrong roads
 And no window stays closed

Williams is trying to convey to the listener, respectively through the two lines the impartialness and temporariness of life.

Life presents us with innumerable roads, and we strive to reach a desirable destination. “Taking a wrong path in life” is a common saying for people who do not get to where they wanted in life.

But Williams rejects this notion and instead, moved a more positive one: albeit getting to a bad destination in life can be frustrating and depressing, these roads took us to a place we all are supposed to be: Forward. Therefore, no life roads are ever wrong or right as long as it got us somewhere.

The second line refers to temporariness. A barred window one day will find itself either being opened, or broken down to show the sky beyond. No journey is without end. No monument stands forever. And most importantly, no love or relationship is permanent.

search_results.full_title: The Trouble with Wanting by Joy Williams
search_results.title: The Trouble with Wanting
search_results.lyrics:
The Trouble with Wanting Lyrics[Verse 1]
Wandering soul
Wandering mind
Wondering what’s gone wrong with me
And try not to try
Swayed by the wind
Swayed by desire
Can’t reach the moon up above
And I don’t dare touch the fire

[Chorus]
'Cause the trouble with wanting is I want you
The trouble with wanting is I want you
The trouble with wanting is I want you
And I want you all the time
[Verse 2]
Always on my mind
Always alone
You could be miles and miles away
But somehow you're close
If I can't have my cake
And I can't eat it too
Well, I guess the sound of your voice
In the aching will just have to do

[Chorus]
'Cause the trouble with wanting is I want you
The trouble with wanting is I want you
The trouble with wanting is I want you
And I want you all the time

[Bridge]
And if you never come back
If you never call
I say I'll understand when I don’t at all

[Chorus]
'Cause the trouble with wanting is I want you
The trouble with wanting is I want you
The trouble with wanting is I want you
And I want you all the time
The trouble with wanting is I want you
The trouble with wanting is I want you
I see you there and I see that line
(The trouble with wanting is I want you)
And I want you all the time
Oh, I want you all the timeYou might also likeEmbed

description.plain:
“The Trouble with Wanting” is about not being able to let go of a past lover and touches on similar themes explored in “When Does The Heart Move On?” and “Front Porch.” Joy illustrates her struggles between her heart’s desires and the somber reality that the man she is in love with doesn’t reciprocate those feelings.

The studio version of “The Trouble with Wanting” was released on Oct. 5, 2018, but was previously shared via Instagram live streams and performed at a handful of performances during May and June of 2018.

search_results.title: Ordinary World
search_results.lyrics:
Ordinary World Lyrics[Verse 1]
Came in from a rainy Thursday on the avenue
Thought I heard you talking softly
I turned on the lights, the TV and the radio
Still I can't escape the ghost of you

[Pre-Chorus 1]
What has happened to it all?
Crazy, some saying
Where is the life that I recognize?
It's gone away
[Chorus]
But I won't cry for yesterday
There's an ordinary world
Somehow I have to find
And as I try to make my way
To the ordinary world
I will learn to survive

[Verse 2]
Passion or coincidence
Once prompted you to say
"The pride will tear us both apart"
Pride's gone out the window
Crossed the rooftops, gone away
Left me in the vacuum of my heart

[Pre-Chorus 2]
What's happening to me?
Crazy, some'd say
Where is my friend when I need you most?
Gone away

[Chorus]
But I won't cry for yesterday
There's an ordinary world
Somehow I have to find
And as I try to make my way
To the ordinary world
I will learn to survive
You might also like[Verse 3]
Papers in the roadside tell of suffering and greed
Here today, forgot tomorrow
Ooh, here besides the news of holy war and holy need
Ours is just a little sorrowed talk

[Chorus]
And I won't cry for yesterday
There's an ordinary world
Somehow I have to find
And as I try to make my way
To the ordinary world
I will learn to survive

[Outro]
Everyone is my world
Everyone is my worldEmbed

search_results.lyrics:
Sweet Love of Mine (Acoustic) Lyrics[Verse 1]
I was broken, I was blind
Lost in a moment I thought I left behind
The you opened this dark soul of mine
Gave me a light I thought I'd never find

[Verse 2]
When you found me I was all alone
The whole world around me
And nowhere to call home
I heard your voice sing like heaven's choir
Gathered up my fears and threw them in the fire
[Chorus]
Oh my darling, sweet love of mine
I'll hold you all through the night
I gave you your name, you gave me back my life
You're the heart of me, oh sweet love of mine
You're the heart of me, oh sweet love of mine

Mmmmm...

Oh my darling, sweet love of mine
I'll hold you all through the night
I gave you your name, you gave me back my life

search_results.title: Wake Up Child
search_results.lyrics:
Wake Up Child Lyrics[Verse 1]
Wake up, child, the summer's gone
Gotta fall in line, gotta stand tall
You've got to hide that glimmer you found
As you danced in the rainfall

[Verse 2]
Don't worry, child, it was no dream
This mortal mind is a guilty thing
You're free to laugh with the giddy bird's call
And with the mountain, sing
[Chorus]
And I can't remember what I'm raised to forget
The child inside
Truth, you know, never dies
Open your eyes
Open your eyes
Open your eyes

[Verse 3]
Come on, bruised and buried soul
You gotta hurry to this heavy yoke
You've got to let this frost settle on you
And forgеt the warmth of home

[Verse 4]
Awake, you еndless fountain stream
There's so much more than what is seen
Go on and fan those embers to flame
Let it light the way you go

[Chorus]
I can't remember what I'm raised to forget
The child inside
Truth, you know, never dies
Open your eyes
Open your eyes
Open your eyesYou might also likeEmbed

search_results.full_title: No Place Like You by Joy Williams
search_results.title: No Place Like You
search_results.lyrics:
No Place Like You Lyrics[Verse 1]
They say home is where the heart is
And my heart is crossing Mississippi line
I've been traveling, roaming
Walked a thousand miles just to
Break down, turn 'round and come back

[Chorus]
Honey it's true
There ain't nothing I can do
'Cause there's no place, no place like you
[Verse 2]
I may ramble, I may wander
But when you kiss me I'm back where I belong
And through the hard times, good times
Wrap me in your arms 'cause I need you
Need you, need you

[Chorus]
Honey it's true
There ain't nothing I can do
'Cause there's no place, no place like you

[Bridge]
I found what I'm looking for
There's no need to run anymore

[Chorus]
Honey it's true
There ain't nothing I can do
'Cause there's no place, no place like you

[Outro]
No, honey it’s true
After all that we’ve been through
There’s still no place, no place, no
No place like youYou might also likeEmbed

search_results.full_title: Until The Levee by Joy Williams
search_results.title: Until The Levee
search_results.lyrics:
Until The Levee Lyrics[Verse 1 - Joy Williams]
I see a ghost out on the water
I swear it has my face
I bend and drink the lonely down, the lonely down
There's trouble on the river
And whispers in the trees
I can feel it all around, all around

[Chorus - Joy Williams]
I'm gonna stand
I'm gonna stand here in the ache
Until the levee, until the levee on my heart breaks
[Verse 2 - Joy Williams]
I'm gonna wade out past the shallows
And brave the bitter taste
I'm gonna drink the lonely down, the lonely down
Let the current take me over
Let the ruin turn to white
I can feel it all around, all around

[Chorus - Joy Williams]
I'm gonna stand
I'm gonna stand here in the ache
Until the levee, until the levee on my heart breaks
I'm gonna stand
I'm gonna stand here in the ache, the ache, the ache

[Bridge - Joy Williams]
So go and let it break
Take all I can take

[Chorus - Joy Williams]
I'm gonna stand
I'm gonna stand here in the ache
Until the levee, oh, until the levee on my heart breaks
Oh, I'm gonna stand
I'm gonna stand here in the ache
Until the levee, until the levee on my heart breaksYou might also likeEmbed

description.plain:
Joy Williams compared the feeling of writing VENUS track “Until The Levee” to being a teabag simmering in hot water, feeling a number of personal pressures around her:

I’ve always loved the Eleanor Roosevelt quote “A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong she is until she’s in hot water.” When I was writing this song, I felt like I was in that hot water. I was at the peak of working through the heartache of the band, was gut-punched over my Dad’s sudden stage 4 cancer diagnosis, doing the hard work in redefining my marriage, grappling to figure out a rhythm as a new mom, and struggling to find any hope in it all. It felt like a lot all at once. I felt like I was in a standoff within myself- to break down and give up from the pain, or to stay with the pain in the hopes that I’d learn how to get stronger through it. Somehow, while I was steeped in the discomfort of it all, I found out I was made of stronger stuff than I thought. This inner resiliency started coming out of me, and I was feeling this heat, this determination to not be overtaken by it. To stand in the ache, to find hope in the midst of it all… even if only just a little.

body.plain:
Joy Williams compared the feeling of writing VENUS track “Until The Levee” to being a teabag simmering in hot water, feeling a number of personal pressures around her:

I’ve always loved the Eleanor Roosevelt quote “A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong she is until she’s in hot water.” When I was writing this song, I felt like I was in that hot water. I was at the peak of working through the heartache of the band, was gut-punched over my Dad’s sudden stage 4 cancer diagnosis, doing the hard work in redefining my marriage, grappling to figure out a rhythm as a new mom, and struggling to find any hope in it all. It felt like a lot all at once. I felt like I was in a standoff within myself- to break down and give up from the pain, or to stay with the pain in the hopes that I’d learn how to get stronger through it. Somehow, while I was steeped in the discomfort of it all, I found out I was made of stronger stuff than I thought. This inner resiliency started coming out of me, and I was feeling this heat, this determination to not be overtaken by it. To stand in the ache, to find hope in the midst of it all… even if only just a little.
